snippet: Now that it's officially fall, it's time to start thinking seriously about buying a coat, of which there are many warm and woolly options.
lead_paragraph: Chances are you weren't ready to buy a winter coat when the first of them started arriving in stores in August, pre-Labor Day, while temperatures still neared 90 degrees. But it's officially fall now, the recent summer's record-breaking heat has long been forgotten, and it's time to start thinking seriously about buying a coat, of which there are many warm and woolly options. Long is the trend, and contemporary labels like Theyskens' Theory and 3.1 Philip Lim deliver it in full. Capes are making a comeback - the fall runways showed versions in everything from mohair to wool -- and cropped peacoats (see Miu Miu and Burberry) are in attendance, too. And then there are parkas, like those from Altuzarra and Valentino's Red Label, that look as good with slip dresses as they do with wool suits, and are versatile enough if you just add layers in January. Coat, check!
